sentence.Network_en: Scott of the Antarctic was a national hero of mythic proportions.
sentence.Network_cn: 南极探险家斯科特是位赫赫有名的民族英雄。

sentence.Network_en: His rapid rise to power has given him a near-mythic status in the industry.
sentence.Network_cn: 他迅速升任要职，这让他在业界近乎被神化了。

sentence.Network_en: What if Plato made up the story for mythic purposes?
sentence.Network_cn: 如果柏拉图所写的只是个神话故事 呢 ?

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: via late Latin from Greek muthikos, from muthos 'myth'

entry.tran: 神话的;只存在于神话中的
entry.def: Someone or something that is mythic exists only in myths and is therefore imaginary.
If you describe someone or something as mythic, you mean that they have become very famous or important.

example.ex: ...a team whose reputation has achieved mythic proportions...
His rapid rise to power has given him a near-mythic status in the industry.
example.tran: 他迅速升任要职，这让他在业界近乎被神化了。

means.word_mean: 1. relating to or having the nature of myth;
2. based on or told of in traditional stories; lacking factual basis or historical validity;

auth_sentence.content: I had no idea who all these mythic figures were.

auth_sentence.content: The mythic narrative concerning Bin Laden seems to grow exponentially.

auth_sentence.content: In its forbidden quality..., their love has a mythic resonance.
